001package gust.backend;
002
003import io.micronaut.runtime.Micronaut;
004
005import javax.annotation.Nonnull;
006import javax.annotation.Nullable;
007import java.io.IOException;
008import java.io.InputStream;
009
010
011/**
012 * Main application class, which bootstraps a backend Gust app via Micronaut, including any configured controllers,
013 * services, or assets. This is where execution starts when running on a JVM. Micronaut uses build-time annotation
014 * processing, and a number of other techniques, to pre-initialize and wire up the app before it ever gets to the
015 * server to be executed at runtime.
016 */
017@SuppressWarnings("WeakerAccess")
018public final class Application {
019  /**
020   * Main entrypoint into a Gust backend application, powered by Micronaut. This function will pre-load any static stuff
021   * that needs to be bootstrapped, and then it initializes the app via Micronaut.
022   *
023   * @param args Arguments passed on the command line.
024   */
025  public static void main(String[] args) {
026    try {
027      ApplicationBoot.load();
028      Micronaut.run(Application.class);
029    } catch (Throwable thr) {
030      ApplicationBoot.reportStartupError(thr);
031    }
032  }
033
034  private Application() { /* Disallow instantiation. */ }
035}
